paper_title: Temperature-dependent discovery of BCC refractory multi-principal element alloys: Integrating deep learning and CALPHAD calculations

claims.claim: For the Ti–Fe–Al–V–Ni–Nb–Zr system at 850 K, using d = 0.03 and a BCC classification threshold of 0.9, the model trained in this study achieves an accuracy of 0.76 in detecting BCC samples.
instruction: Open and run all cells in PhaseLabeling.ipynb.
After execution, open the file Phases.txt.
Count the number of rows where the value in the 11th column is greater than 0.9.
Divide this by the total number of rows in the file.
